reviewText: Again we are awaiting new releases of this series.
This series has original characters, The plotting is engaging, the scenes of Hamburg are lovely and diverse.  The acting is excellent.  One grows fond of Bukow and Konig.
Excellent in every way!! Thanks lots.

I love this series and will be looking for set 3...if it exists. It takes place in Rostock, a northern German city on the Baltic Sea. The two main characters complement each other...Bukow is somewhat unkempt, doesn't always go by the books, and is a native of the city. His partner, Konig, is the opposite ...straight laced and plays by the rules. The crimes are well plotted and the supporting characters very interesting, e.g. a German motorcycle gang. The series is intelligent, sometimes tense and sometimes violent but thoroughly enjoyable. Highly recommended.
These are really well done with very believable characters.

Bukow (pronounced Bukov) Knig is the current part of a long-running German police series, Polizeiruf 110.  It is excellent.  Intriguing mysteries, with wonderful cultural intricacies. Knig is from West Germany, whereas Bukov has been reassigned to his home town in what was East Germany.  But, thee are sub-plots involving Knig investigating whether Bubov was blackmailed into letting a Russian mafia guy go free, and something mysterious involving Knig's childhood, and all sorts of personal dramas from the police staff.  Very complicated, but the writing team makes it work, and the acting is excellent.  It is a very compelling series, and well worth the investment.
Great stories.. Need more than two seasons!
Glad to see there was a season 2; too many times they produce a good series and stop after the first one.  Doubtful they'll have a series 3 but they sure were good.
Good series with a European feel and characters who work well

So glad they did a second season.  It seems that so many advertise "Season 1," then hook you in and never come back with Season 2, much less Season 4.  We keep up with what's out and what is already showing in Europe and the Scandinavian countries.  America is being deprived of the best unless they invest in an "all region player" for DVD's otherwise not available for streaming, which we are so glad we did) and ordering direct from other countries or from amazon.co.uk, because they get them quicker for distribution to Europe.
Fun German entertainment - engaging characters that grow on you with time

what a great set of characters. Konig is the only one that you can really like. Bukow is an emotional mess who cannot control his temper. What an interesting contrast to the normal cool, calculating cop. We just watched the 2nd episode on the 2nd series. Is Bukow about to have wife trouble also?? Stay tuned.

This is a very entertaining series, Konig's original distrust of Bukow gradually fades, I also look forward to another season Hopefully!!
It is worth seeing with subtitles.
Bukow and Knig: Set 2 Convincing characters, great actors, I love the setting
